stories.original_headline: New DNA analysis rewrites the story of the Beachy Head Woman
stories.original_summary: A Roman-era skeleton discovered in southern England has finally given up her secrets after more than a decade of debate. Known as the Beachy Head Woman, she was once thought to have roots in sub-Saharan Africa or the Mediterranean—an idea that sparked global attention. But new, high-quality DNA anal
stories.fantasy_headline: Ancient Bones Reveal True Tale of Beachy Head Maiden
stories.fantasy_story: After much debate, powerful Wizards have studied the ancient bones of the Beachy Head Maiden. Their potent runes now show she hailed from the frosty northern lands, not the sun-drenched coastal kingdoms. This grand discovery re-writes tales whispered throughout the realm for ages.

stories.original_headline: Alzheimer’s may trick the brain into erasing its own memories
stories.original_summary: Alzheimer’s may destroy memory by flipping a single molecular switch that tells neurons to prune their own connections. Researchers found that both amyloid beta and inflammation converge on the same receptor, triggering synapse loss. Surprisingly, neurons aren’t passive victims—they actively respond
stories.fantasy_headline: Memory Blight Tricks Minds to Erase Their Own Past
stories.fantasy_story: Wizards of the Mind have uncovered a dark secret of the Fading Sickness. It seems this dread malady casts a potent spell, convincing mind-threads to sever their own connections. Instead of a passive affliction, the mind's own magic is turned against its cherished recollections.
